lyrics:
It's 8 a.m.
This hell I'm in
Seems I've crossed the line again
For being nothing more than who I am
So break my bones
And throw your stones
We all know that life ain't fair
But there's more of us we're everywhere

We don't have to take this
Back against the wall
We don't have to take this
We can end it all

All you'll ever be is the fading memory of a bully
Make another joke while they hang another rope so lonely
Push them to the dirt till the words don't hurt
Can you hear me?
No one's gonna cry on the very day you die you're a bully

Think it through
You can't undo
Whenever I see black and blue
I feel the past
I share the bruise

With everyone
Who's come and gone
My head is clear my voice is strong
Now I'm right here to right the wrong

We don't have to take this
Back against the wall
We don't have to take this
We can end it all

All you'll ever be is the fading memory of a bully
Make another joke while they hang another rope so lonely
Push them to the dirt till the words don't hurt
Can you hear me?
No one's gonna cry on the very day you die you're a bully

It's 8 a.m.
The hell I'm in
Your voice is strong
Now right the wrong

All you'll ever be is the fading memory of a bully
Make another joke while they hang another rope so lonely
Push them to the dirt till the words don't hurt
Can you hear me?
No one's gonna cry on the very day you die you're a bully

All you'll ever be is the fading memory of a bully
Make another joke while they hang another rope so lonely
Push them to the dirt till the words don't hurt
Can you hear me?
No one's gonna cry on the very day you die you're a bully
